subject: Mental Health
title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
description: A short lesson to help you apply Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder.

hook.text: You lock the door, walk away, then return to check it five more times.

buildup.text: OCD traps people in a cycle of intrusive thoughts and repetitive behaviors.

discovery.text: The obsessions create unbearable doubt; the compulsions offer brief relief.

twist.text: The relief never lasts, so the brain demands the ritual again and again.

climax.text: Brain scans show a faulty error-detection circuit stuck in a feedback loop.

punchline.text: The brain whispers something is wrong â€” forever.
